oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Advertisement from Nashville City Directory, 1871
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An advertisement of the Evansville, Henderson & Nashville Railroad, published in the 1871 Nashville City Directory. It states: “This route is 21 miles shorter from Nashville to St. Louis than any other route ... through tickets and information can be obtained at the General Tick Office, Maxwell House, and at the Depot of the Edgefield & Kentucky and Louisville and Nashville Railroads, College Street, Nashville., H.L. Shepherd, Superintendent; Hugh Pitcairn, Asst. Supt.” The Evansville, Henderson & Nashville Railroad was incorporated by act of the Kentucky Legislature, approved January 29, 1867, with power to construct and operate a railroad from Henderson to the Kentucky-Tennessee state line in the direction of Nashville. On October 1, 1872, the E. H. & N., with three other roads, consolidated into the St. Louis & Southeastern Railway Company. Forms part of Nashville City Directory Collection, Metro Archives. 1 digital image.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Evansville, Henderson, and Nashville Railroad Company
